_meta.artifact_name: Strategy Alignment - Air Quality & Mold Risk Policy Scaling
_meta.policy_context: Scaling Air Quality & Mold Risk Policy Beyond Military Pilot

feature_mapping.feature_description: Scaling Air Quality & Mold Risk Policy Beyond Military Pilot - Legislative and mobilization strategy to extend military facility air quality standards to broader civilian application (public housing, schools, private residential via insurance incentives)

questionnaire_objectives.objective_description: Policy opportunity: Regulatory demand for air quality standards beyond military context
questionnaire_objectives.impact_pathway: EPA/HUD rulemaking windows create opportunity for policy scaling. Industry signals show demand for standardized air quality monitoring.
evidence: EPA announced upcoming rulemaking on indoor air quality standards
HUD interest in evidence-based standards for public housing
Health insurance industry cost drivers (respiratory illness claims)
School districts reporting inconsistent state/local standards

questionnaire_objectives.objective_description: Scale: Extend military pilot findings to broader civilian application
questionnaire_objectives.impact_pathway: Multiple scaling pathways: military facilities → veteran housing → public housing → public schools → private residential. Each pathway builds on previous success.
scaling_pathways: Military facilities → Veteran housing (VA, HUD) - High feasibility
Military facilities → Public housing (HUD) - High feasibility
Military facilities → Public schools - Medium feasibility
Military facilities → Private residential (via insurance) - Medium feasibility

questionnaire_objectives.objective_description: Risk: Costly and harmful if policy scaling fails or misrepresents military findings
questionnaire_objectives.impact_pathway: Stop condition: Evidence verification required. Ethical boundaries: No false health claims, no misrepresentation of military findings. Risk mitigation through independent verification and human review gates.
risk_factors: Industry opposition (property management, real estate development)

strategic_objectives.objective_description: Leverage military pilot success to inform broader public health policy
strategic_objectives.impact_pathway: Military pilot provides evidence base for scaling. Link to CDC health guidance on mold exposure and respiratory health.
success_metrics: EPA rulemaking incorporates military pilot findings
HUD public housing regulations reference military facility standards
State health departments adopt federal coordination framework

strategic_objectives.objective_description: Build coalition for policy scaling across multiple jurisdictions
strategic_objectives.impact_pathway: Veterans organizations provide natural bridge. Health insurance industry provides economic case. Tenant advocacy provides grassroots support.
success_metrics: Health insurance industry endorses preventive policy measures

strategic_objectives.objective_description: Create legislative and mobilization strategy (not execution)
strategic_objectives.impact_pathway: Generate reviewable artifacts for human decision-making. Strategy documents inform execution planning without committing to external actions.

business_value.time_horizon: 6-12 months to initial policy engagement, 12-24 months to pilot deployment
value_drivers: Public health impact: Reduced respiratory illness from improved air quality
Economic value: Health insurance cost reduction through preventive measures
Policy leverage: Military pilot success provides evidence base for scaling
Coalition building: Natural allies in veterans organizations and health sector
cost_considerations: Evidence verification costs (independent verification of military pilot findings)

recommendations: Proceed with legislative strategy development aligned to OPPORTUNITY, SCALE, and RISK objectives
Prioritize evidence verification before advancing beyond PRE_EVT (stop condition)
Coordinate with veterans organizations as natural bridge from military to civilian context
Engage health insurance industry for economic case development
Monitor EPA and HUD rulemaking windows for policy vehicle opportunities
Maintain ethical boundaries: No false health claims, accurate representation of military findings

organizational_capabilities.note: Capability assessments not available - proceeding speculatively

scaling_strategy_summary.primary_pathway: Military facilities → HUD public housing → EPA rulemaking → State/local implementation
scaling_strategy_summary.secondary_pathway: Military facilities → Veteran housing → Public schools → Private residential (insurance incentives)
key_leverage_points: HUD public housing authority (direct scaling path)
critical_dependencies: Independent verification of military pilot evidence (stop condition)
HR_PRE approval of concept memo (blocking gate)
